ai.summary: A challenging 16.7 km circuit near Witton Gilbert, UK. This hard hike blends continuous ascent with uneven surfaces across fields, woodlands and rural lanes, demanding solid navigation and fitness from experienced walkers.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of grassy and rocky tracks, muddy woodland paths, stony ascents, and occasional exposure on higher ground. Terrain can be slippery when wet; gates and stiles may require careful footing.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for changing UK weather and daylight; wear sturdy boots and bring extra layers. Stay on waymarked routes and carry a map and compass or GPS. The route includes long ascents on uneven ground; watch for mud, livestock, gates, and boggy sections. Start early in winter months and tell someone your plan with estimated return. Carry enough water and food, a charged phone, and a basic first aid kit; bring a light source if there’s a risk of fading daylight.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass (or GPS device) and/or offline route
Trekking poles (optional but helpful for ascent and descent)
Emergency whistle and a charged power bank for your phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn; typically March to October offers the best conditions and daylight. Winter hikes are possible but require careful planning and experience with navigating in poor weather.

seo.title: H100 – Witton Gilbert (UK) 16.7 km Hard Hike
seo.meta_description: Explore H100 Witton Gilbert: a 16.7 km hard hike in the UK featuring varied terrain, challenging climbs, and practical safety tips.
